page.title: 17THE HARBOUR
page.content: {The Harbour}lies just beyond the pumping station at the mouth of the { {Blind Yeo River in the West End of {Clevedon. It is a natural harbour in that there are no walls or man-made moorings. It is used by private boat owners with small yachts and motor boats who tie up in and around the runnels in the extensive mudflats left when the tide goes out. The Bristol Channel tide has cut many deep,but narrow channels and because of the unusually large tide range along this coast the boats must be moored on long ropes to cope with the large daily rise and fall. From the harbour you can walk along the sea wall towards {Sand Bay}past more mudflats.
